author: Associated Press
title: NHL:
text: Posted: 10/15/2015 09:52:33 PM PDT Updated: 10/15/2015 09:59:03 PM PDT THURSDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Penguins 2, Senators 0: Evgeni Malkin scored his first goal in nearly seven months and Marc-Andre Fleury stopped 22 shots for his 39th career shutout. Capitals 4, Blackhawks 1: Braden Holtby stopped 26 shots, Alex Ovechkin scored a goal in his return to the lineup for Washington. Islanders 4, Predators 3: John Tavares and Nikolay Kulemin scored in the third period and New York held on against Nashville. Stars 5, Lightning 3: Jason Spezza scored a momentum-shifting goal in the third period and had an assist as Dallas triumphed. Panthers 3, Sabres 2: Jaromir Jagr scored twice in the first period and added an assist to lead Florida. Canadiens 3, Rangers 0: Carey Price made 25 saves and Montreal made team history by starting a season with a five straight wins. Tomas Fleischmann, Dale Weise and Tomas Plekanec, with an empty-net effort, scored for the Canadiens (5-0-0), who handed the Rangers (3-2-0) a second straight defeat. Blues 4, Oilers 2: Paul Stastny and Alexander Steen scored in the third period to spoil Edmonton's home opener. Devils: New Jersey's Jordin Tootoo was fined more than $2,200 for a dangerous trip in a game Tuesday against Nashville. Advertisement
